DataElement.preferredName: Blood Oxygen Level Dependent Arterial Spin Labeling Cerebral Metabolic Oxygen Rate
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the rate of oxygen metabolism or consumption in the brain as measured by BOLD-ASL imaging. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blood Oxygen Level Dependent Imaging Arterial Spin Labeling Cerebral Metabolic Oxygen Rate
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A magnetic resonance imaging technique that uses the difference between the magnetic signals of hemoglobin when it is carrying oxygen (oxyhemoglobin) and when it is not carrying oxygen (deoxyhemoglobin) to detect metabolic activity, and hence neurologic activity, in the brain._A blood vessel that carries blood away from the heart._All written, printed, or graphic matter accompanying an article at any time while such article is in interstate commerce or held for sale after shipment or delivery in interstate commerce._(seh-REE-bral HEM-iss-feer) One half of the cerebrum, the part of the brain that controls muscle functions and also controls speech, thought, emotions, reading, writing, and learning. The right hemisphere controls the muscles on the left side of the body, and the left hemisphere controls the muscles on the right side of the body._Having to do with metabolism._An element with atomic symbol O, atomic number 8, and atomic weight 16._A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Blood Oxygen Level Dependant Imaging Artery Labeling
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Utilizes Magnetic Resonance Imaging and the fact that hemoglobin gives off a different magnetic signal when it is carrying oxygen (oxyhemoglobin) compared to when it is not carrying oxygen (deoxyhemoglobin). (from http://www.musc.edu/fnrd/function.htm):The vessels carrying blood away from the heart.:All written, printed, or graphic matter accompanying an article at any time while such article is in interstate commerce or held for sale after shipment or delivery in interstate commerce.

Concepts.definition: A magnetic resonance imaging technique that uses the difference between the magnetic signals of hemoglobin when it is carrying oxygen (oxyhemoglobin) and when it is not carrying oxygen (deoxyhemoglobin) to detect metabolic activity, and hence neurologic activity, in the brain.
A blood vessel that carries blood away from the heart.
All written, printed, or graphic matter accompanying an article at any time while such article is in interstate commerce or held for sale after shipment or delivery in interstate commerce.

Property.preferredDefinition: (seh-REE-bral HEM-iss-feer) One half of the cerebrum, the part of the brain that controls muscle functions and also controls speech, thought, emotions, reading, writing, and learning. The right hemisphere controls the muscles on the left side of the body,:Having to do with metabolism.:use this term only for elemental or gaseous oxygen (02); for other compounds see OXYGEN COMPOUND.:A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: The part of the brain that controls muscle functions and also controls speech, thought, emotions, reading, writing, and learning. The right hemisphere controls the muscles on the left side of the body, and the left hemisphere controls the muscles on the right side of the body.
An element with atomic symbol O, atomic number 8, and atomic weight 16.
A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Limited to a particular location or area._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._The continuous movement characteristic of a liquid or gas._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed._A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time. (NCI)_Having to do with metabolism._An element with atomic symbol O, atomic number 8, and atomic weight 16.

ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
